Apply for Programs

Take the first step towards empowerment and growth. Choose a program that aligns with your goals and join our ohana.

How to Apply

1

Choose Your Program

Browse our programs below and select the one that best fits your needs and goals.

2

Submit Application

Complete the application form with your information and program preferences.

3

Get Started

Our team will review your application and contact you to begin your journey.

Available Programs

Click on any program below to learn more and start your application process.

Workforce Development & Tech Training

Empowering individuals with the skills needed to thrive in the modern economy through comprehensive tech training and workforce development programs.

Learn MoreApply Now

Veteran Empowerment & Transition Support

Providing dedicated support and resources to help veterans successfully transition to civilian life, including career services and wellness programs.

Learn MoreApply Now

Educational & Cultural Advancement

Fostering a deeper connection to Native Hawaiian culture and promoting lifelong learning through a variety of educational and cultural initiatives.

Learn MoreApply Now

Financial Literacy & Economic Mobility

Building a foundation for financial independence and economic mobility through targeted financial literacy education and resources.

Learn MoreApply Now

Community Reinvestment & Technology Equity

Investing in underserved communities by improving access to technology and promoting digital equity for all.

Learn MoreApply Now

Scholarships, Grants & Direct Aid

Providing direct financial support to students, families, and community members through a range of scholarships, grants, and aid programs.

Learn MoreApply Now

Need Help?

Have questions about our programs or need assistance with your application?

Our team is here to help guide you through the process.

Contact Us

Ohana Mana Koa is a Native Hawaiian–owned and veteran-led 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that empowers Native Hawaiian families, veterans, and underserved communities through culturally grounded programs focused on education, economic mobility, and self-determination.
